data.title: Wonderful surprise in downtown Visalia
data.text:
Three of us enjoyed dinner here  their salsa is out of this world good with fresh warm tortilla chips two of us had combination plates and one had the chili verde and said it was delicious the entire meal was very tasty and the service was superb 
Would definitely return here again

data.title: Great Mexican
data.text: I found the staff in this restaurant to be very friendly and helpful.  We liked corn chips and salsa, so fresh.  The menu had a good selection of dishes available while our wait staff explained the daily specials.  The food was tasty and was served promptly.

data.title: Great Mexican food in Visalia
data.text: The Salazar family apparently has several restaurants throughout the central valley.  I've been to this restaurant several times with friends and the food and service have always been very good.  The margaritas are great too.  This is a good spot to visit with family and friends.

data.title: YUMMY, great made from scratch and very fresh ingedients
data.text: In Florida we wish we had restaurants like this in our smaller towns, Atmosphere is great, clean restaurant and food was fantastic and fresh !! Very enjoyable family operation

data.title: This is one of my favorite Mexican restaurants
data.text: Always great food and service and margaritas very good also.  Chips and salsa some of the best, and all you want without having to pay extra for more.

data.title: Excellent food and better service!
data.text: We are regulars at Henry's. They have s quite place to unwind after a hard work day. The chili verde is amazing. We have not had a bad meal or drink here! Go! You will enjoy it!

data.title: Watch what your saying
data.text: I was having lunch with a close friend to lend support talk and about problems she was having at work. Neither of us talk loudly and we were leaning into the conversation to keep it private. A couple days later when she got back to work; the owner asked her out right if she was planing on leaving. After asking the owner a few questions, she found out our server at Henrys knew one of the gals that worked in the office and told her some of the conversation she overheard.She had only talked to me about the problems at work. I spoke to the owner of Henrys, in person, about what happened. He said we wasn't going to do anything, not even speak to our server, because it was our word against the hers. If his employees won't keep to a code of confidence to anything that they hear at their tables; how can the customers feel comfortable with anything being said at the table or about eating there?? I WILL NEVER EAT THERE AGAIN!!

data.title: Another Return Trip to Henry Salazar's on Main Street!
data.text: Good menu choices for all. From the tasty salsa to the main dishes, it satisfies the palate. It's nice to see owner, Henry Salazar, greet guests as you walk in. As a former Visalian, it's good to be remembered after several years of being away from my home town. Convenient location, good service and nice surroundings. Would recommend.

data.title: Nice spot for lunch
data.text: I enjoyed a business lunch at the restaurant. I ordered the half size of the burrito and it was plenty for lunch.  They have a new lunch special menu during the weekdays which worked perfect.  The flavor was great on the burrito fantastic and it was not too heavy. I would recommend it.

data.title: Great food in the old Visalia area
data.text: Pretty basic decor, but the great thing here is the food. The menu has some nice variety and there was something for everyone. The salsa is fresh and has some nice heat. The kitchen area is out in the open and we didn't wait too long for our meals. Service was friendly and the food was excellent!

data.title: Best Mexican Food in Old Visalia
data.text: Great food, ideal location downtown, nice waiter's. Extra parking around back. Large menu including several fish specials. Good for families or for a romantic interlude.

data.title: Here's an updated review from recent visit
data.text: We went back for dinner yesterday and I have to say it was disappointing. I ordered the lobster enchiladas and my wife had the carnitas. I asked the waiter prior to ordering to make sure it was really lobster, he said yes, but I really believe it was actually langostino not lobster. They were just OK, but my wife's carnitas were dry and lacking flavor. There are many other better choices in town for good Mexican food so we won't be going back, and I would not recommend eating here. The only really good thing we had was the salsa.

data.title: Good place for a group
data.text: a dozen of us walked from the Visalia Convention center and it was well worth the walk. Service was good, especially considering that we were a group. Chips and salsa went well with the large drink selection. The fiesta platter was nice, the burrito large and the Caesar salad good.

data.title: Placing an order to go is not the way to go at Henry's.
data.text: Called to place an order to go.  Was asked if I could hold for a minute, I responded "yes".  Well, after nearly 6 minutes on hold, I hung up.  We have ordered Henry's for several celebrations and the food has always been wonderful.  I have no issue with the food but being put on hold for an extended period of time just to place an order is so not cool. We ordered from Colima's.

data.title: It's been a while, but will go again
data.text: We hadn't been here for quite a while, but the reviews were good so we went for lunch to try for ourselves this past Sunday. This is a good day to go as it wasn't overly crowded and there was ample parking as is not the case downtown on the weekdays. I had the marinated short ribs with fresh vegetables and whole pinto beans which was pretty good with good portion size. My wife had a tostada.

data.title: Great salsa!
data.text: Excellent service and variety of menu items. One of the top three Mexican restaurants in Visalia. The ambience is best of the three.

data.title: Terrific
data.text: The service is good and the staff are welcoming. The food is served promptly but we never feel rushed. We feel comfortable  bringing young children. The food is  consistently A+, this is a good place for lunch and dinner. This is always a good place to stop.

data.title: Great tasting fresh mexican food
data.text: Nice quick seating, fresh salsa with fresh chips.  Margarita was tasty, according to my husband.  I ordered a taco salad - very good, fresh avocados, beans, chicken.  Taco shell made fresh when salad was ordered.  It was so tasty and fresh.  My husband had tacos which he loved!  Priced right!  I can not wait to go back!

data.title: Some of the best Mexican Food "EVER"
data.text:
In the central valley of California, there is the Salazar Brothers Restaurants ( Bobby Salazar's, Salazar's & Henry Salazar's), all are extremely good.
Had dinner at Henry Salazar's on Sat. 9/13, was one of the best Mexican Food meals ever.
The pricing is great, service is great and the food can not be beat.
Linen napkins, ample portions, salsa is magical.
If I am ever in Visalia, CA again, this will be the first place I go.

data.title: Very nice place in downtown Visalia, Calif.
data.text: We went to downtown on a late Sunday afternoon and got a parking place easily.  The waiter and the owner were very nice and courteous.  The food was great and a very fair price.  I had the combination of Enchilada and Tostada.  The portion was so big that I had to bring home some...and my Mother brought home a lot in her container.  The background music was so good, too....Spanish guitar (on stereo, not live performer).
